H0.text: Tar is the product made from silica sand, a resource used in large volume in Nevada.

H1.text: Glass is the product made from silica sand, a resource used in large volume in Nevada.

H2.text: Plastic is the product that is made from silica sand, a resource used in large volumes in Nevada.

H3.text: Electricity is the product made from silica sand, a resource used in large volume in Nevada.

A4.text: For high melting point casting, such as steels, a minimum of 98% pure silica sand must be used;

A5.text: This sand is usually used when casting large steel workpieces.

A6.text: Glass can form naturally from volcanic magma.

A7.text: Obsidian is a common volcanic glass with high silica (SiO2) content formed when felsic lava extruded from a volcano cools rapidly.

A8.text: Silica is the primary ingredient in the production of most glass.
